asteroids.model

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • asteroids.model.Entity
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bullet, Ship

    public abstract class Entity
extends java.lang.Object
    A class of entities involving a position, velocity, radius and mass.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Simon Merckx and Tobias Cornille. We both study informatics (1ba). Private repo on https://github.com/tobiascornille/Asteroids Please send us an email with your account info so we can add you as a contributer.
    Invariants:
  • The position of each entity must be a valid position for any entity.
         isValidPosition(this.getPosition())
  • The velocity of each entity must be a valid velocity for any entity.
         isValidVelocity(this.getVelocity())
  • Each entity can have its radius as radius.
         canHaveAsRadius(this.getRadius())
  • The world of each entity must be a valid world for this entity.
         isValidWorld(getWorld())

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Entity(double radius)
      Initialize this new entity with given radius.
      Entity(Vector position, Vector velocity, double radius)
      Initialize this new entity with given X coordinate of the position, given Y coordinate of the position, given X component of the velocity, given Y component of the velocity and given orientation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entity

        public Entity(double radius)
        Initialize this new entity with given radius.
        Effect:
        The radius of this new ship is set to the given radius.
             this.setRadius(radius)

      • Entity

        public Entity(Vector position,
              Vector velocity,
              double radius)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Initialize this new entity with given X coordinate of the position, given Y coordinate of the position, given X component of the velocity, given Y component of the velocity and given orientation.
        Parameters:
        position - The position of this new entity.
        velocity - The velocity of this new entity.
        radius - The radius of this new entity.
        Effects:
      • The position of this new entity is set to the given position.
             this.setPosition(position)
      • The velocity of this new entity is set to the given velocity.
            this.setVelocity(velocity)
      • The radius of this new ship is set to the given radius.
             this.setRadius(radius)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the radius is invalid. | ! canHaveAsRadius(radius)

      • isValidPosition

        public static boolean isValidPosition(Vector position)
        Check whether the given position is a valid position for any entity.
        Parameters:
        position - The position to check.
        Returns:
        If this entity doesn't have a world it's position will always be correct.
             result == true

      • hasValidPositionInWorld

        public boolean hasValidPositionInWorld(World world)
        Check whether this entity has a valid position in the given world.
        Parameters:
        world - The given world.
        Returns:
        True if this entity is a ship in an unbounded space.
             if (world == null && this instanceof Ship)
             then result == true;
        Returns:
        True if this entity is a bullet in an unbounded space.
             if (world == null && this instanceof Ship && ((Bullet) this).getShip() == null)
             then result == true;
        Returns:
        True if this entity is a bullet in a ship.
             if (world == null && this instanceof Ship && ((Bullet) this).isInShip(((Bullet) this).getShip()))
             then result == true;
        Returns:
        True if this entity lies within the bounds of the given world and this entity doesn't overlap in the given world.
             if (this.liesWithinBoundsWorld(world) && (! this.checkOverlapInWorld(world)))
             then result == true;
        Returns:
        False in other cases.

      • liesWithinBoundsWorld

        public boolean liesWithinBoundsWorld(World world)
        Check whether this entity lies within the boundaries of the given world.
        Parameters:
        world - The given world.
        Returns:
        True if the X component of the position of this entity is in the range [0, width] and the Y component is in the range [0, height].
             @see implementation

      • getDistanceBetween

        public double getDistanceBetween(Entity other)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the distance between two entities. The distance may be negative if both entities overlap. The distance between a entity and itself is zero.
        Parameters:
        other - The other entity.
        Returns:
        0, if both entities are the same.
             if (this == entity)
             then result == 0
        Returns:
        The distance between the two entities with coordinates (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) respectively and their radii is returned.
             result == (Math.sqrt(((x2 - x1) * (x2 - x1)) + ((y2 - y1) * (y2 - y1))) - r1 - r2)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If this method is invoked with null as argument. | entity == null

      • overlap

        public boolean overlap(Entity other)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns true if and only if 2 entities overlap. A entity always overlaps with itself.
        Parameters:
        other - The other entity.
        Returns:
        Returns true if and only if 2 entities overlap.
             result == (this.getDistanceBetween(entity) <= 0)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If this method is invoked with null as argument. | entity == null

      • isValidVelocity

        public static boolean isValidVelocity(Vector velocity)
        Check whether the given velocity is a valid velocity for any entity.
        Parameters:
        velocity - The velocity to check.
        Returns:
        True if the absolute value of the speed, the magnitude of the velocity vector, is less than C.
             result == velocity.getMagnitude() <= C

             if (world == null)
             result == true
        Returns:

             result == (this.getWorld() == null) && (this.inWorld(world))

        public abstract void terminate()

      • getTimeToCollision

        public double getTimeToCollision(Entity other)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Return when, if ever, two entities will collide. Return Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if the entities never collide. This method does not apply to entities that overlap.
        Parameters:
        entity - The other entity.
        Returns:
        Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if the entities never collide.
             if (this.getCollisionPosition(other) == null)
             result == Double.POSTIVE_INFINITY
        Returns:
        The time the entity needs to reach the collision position.
             while (new.getPosition != this.getCollisionPosition(other)) {
             time += dt
             this.move(dt)
             }
             result == time
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This method is invoked with null pointer as argument. | other == null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This method is invoked with two overlapping entities. | this.overlap(other)

      • getCollisionPosition

        public Vector getCollisionPosition(Entity other)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Return where, if ever, two entities will collide. Return null if the entities never collide.
        Parameters:
        other - The other entity
        Returns:
        Null if the ships never collide.
             if (this.getTimeToCollision(entity) == Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY)
             then return null
        Returns:
        The position where the distance between the entities is equal to the sum of their radii.
             if (this.getDistanceBetween(other) == this.getRadius() + other.getRadius())
             return position
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If this method is invoked with null pointer as argument. | other == null

      • getTimeToCollisionBoundary

        public double getTimeToCollisionBoundary()
        Return when, if ever, this entity collides with a boundary. Return Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if this entity never collides with a boundary.
        Parameters:
        entity - The other entity.
        Returns:
        Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if the entity never collides with the boundary.
             if (this.getCollisionBoundaryPosition() == null)
             result == Double.POSTIVE_INFINITY
        Returns:
        The time this entity needs to reach the collision position.
             while (new.getPosition != this.getCollisionBoundaryPosition()) {
             time += dt
             this.move(dt)
             }
             result == time

      • getCollisionBoundaryPosition

        public Vector getCollisionBoundaryPosition()
        Return where, if ever, this entity collides with a boundary. Return null if the entity never collides with a boundary.
        Parameters:
        other - The other entity
        Returns:
        Null if the ship never collides with a boundary.
             if (this.getTimeToCollision(entity) == Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY)
             then return null
        Returns:
        The position where the distance between this entity and a boundary is equal the radius of this entity.
             if (this.getDistanceBetween(boundary) == this.getRadius())
             return position
